questions.text: I respect power most when it is guided by ethics and reason.
I’m comfortable enforcing boundaries without needing applause.
I prefer influence through expertise and knowledge.
I can negotiate outcomes without humiliating anyone.
I feel a surge of calm when I have control over the outcome.
I feel guilty asserting my needs when others are struggling.
If a system feels unfair, I reject it rather than play along.
I feel safer when people admire me than when they truly know me.
I gain authority by building results that can’t be ignored.
I can lead through inspiration, not just direction.
I create structure and ritual that helps people thrive.
I’m willing to step into danger if it protects what matters.
I assume betrayal is possible, so I keep safeguards in place.
I keep emotions out of the room so I can stay in control.
I agree outwardly, but privately I feel trapped and resentful.
